Subjects: sermons, verse in; lechery, warning against
_description: A warning against Lechery (8 lines), a tag in the Fasciculus morum

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Who so lyvyth in flesly wyllAnd it no wyl not leteAfftyr hym
                    shall lyke yllþat he thowght it so swetelechery wol þi sole
                    spillþat is so vn to meteWhen thy body lyith in erth
                    styllþe sole mote all bete

BodRawC670.First Lines:
Wo so leuyth in flescly wyllAnd hit ne woll noȝt
                    lete…
BodRawC670.Last Lines:
…Whan þi body lyþe in erþe stilleÞe sowle
                    mote all bete
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 196.

CamGon71.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “A Warning Against Lechery.” 
             Philological Quarterly
         35 (1956): 90-5: 91.

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Wo so lyueþ in flechly syne wylleAnd he it wul
                    noȝt letteAfter hym schal leke ylleÞat hyt þouth hym so
                    swetlychery wyl þat soule spyleþat is so vn to meteWen
                    þi boþey lyþe ouer styleþe schal sall be all to
                    bett
